title: 'Modern-day Monuments Men' taskforce set to scour the UK to save historic buildings
text:
The Monuments Men were a team of intellectuals who bravely took on the Nazis to save precious artworks and heirlooms from destruction during the Second World War. They were later depicted in a 2014 film directed by George Clooney.

Now, they are being invoked to create a new taskforce to save Britain’s historic buildings.

This modern-day team of "monuments men and women" will scour villages, towns and cities across ten English counties in search of "neglected and unloved" buildings with potential historical or architectural significance.

Some of the buildings that may have been overlooked include the terraced house in Liverpool where Ringo Starr was born in 1940, the city's art deco Littlewoods...
description: The Monuments Men were a team of intellectuals who bravely took on the Nazis to save precious artworks and heirlooms from destruction during the Second World War.
